questions.q: Which part of the cell is called the 'Powerhouse of the Cell'?
Excluding stoppages, the speed of a bus is $54 \text{ km/hr}$ and including stoppages, it is $45 \text{ km/hr}$. For how many minutes does the bus stop per hour?
questions.e:
Use the "Difference/Fast" trick.
Time $= \frac{\text{Fast Speed} - \text{Slow Speed}}{\text{Fast Speed}} \times 60$.
Time $= \frac{54 - 45}{54} \times 60$.
Time $= \frac{9}{54} \times 60 = \frac{1}{6} \times 60 = 10 \text{ min}$.
questions.e2:
In 1 hour, without stops, it travels $54 \text{ km}$.
With stops, it travels only $45 \text{ km}$.
Shortfall is $9 \text{ km}$.
Time taken to cover $9 \text{ km}$ at original speed ($54 \text{ km/hr}$):
$t = \frac{9}{54} \text{ hr} = \frac{1}{6} \text{ hr}$.
$\frac{1}{6} \times 60 = 10 \text{ min}$.

questions.q: Donald Trump has been elected as the _____ President of the United States in the 2024 elections.
Who was the first woman President of India?
Who is the author of the book "Why Bharat Matters"?

Six people A, B, C, D, E and F are sitting around a circular table facing the centre. C sits second to the left of B. E is an immediate neighbour of B. F sits third to the left of E. D sits second to the left of A. Who sits to the immediate right of A?
questions.e:
Draw the circle (Facing Center $\to$ Left is Clockwise, Right is Anti-clockwise).
1. **Fix B & C**: Place B. C is 2nd to the left.
2. **Place E**: E is B's neighbor. If E is right of B, F (opposite E) would overlap C. So, E is left of B (between B and C).
3. **Place F**: F is 3rd left of E $\to$ F sits opposite E.
4. **Place A & D**: The only spots left fit A such that D is 2nd to his left. A sits next to C.
5. **Final Order (Clockwise)**: A $\to$ F $\to$ D $\to$ B $\to$ E $\to$ C.
6. **Result**: Immediate right of A is **C**. ```

questions.q: The angle of elevation of the sun when the length of the shadow of a tree is equal to its height is:
questions.e:
Concept: If Height $=$ Base, then $\tan \theta = 1$.
$\tan 45^\circ = 1$.
Angle is $45^\circ$.
questions.e2:
Let height $= h$ and shadow $= s$.
Given $h = s$.
$\tan \theta = \frac{h}{s} = \frac{h}{h} = 1$.
$\theta = 45^\circ$.

questions.q: Two circles of radii $5 \text{ cm}$ and $3 \text{ cm}$ touch each other externally. What is the distance between their centers?
questions.e:
Concept: Touching Externally $\implies$ Distance Adds.
$D = R_1 + R_2$.
$D = 5 + 3 = 8 \text{ cm}$.
questions.e2:
If they touched internally, distance would be difference.
Here, External touch.
Draw line joining centers passing through touch point.
Length is sum of radii.
$5 + 3 = 8$.

questions.q: The Nobel Prize in Literature 2024 was awarded to which South Korean author?
Which is the smallest bone in the human body?
questions.e:
The Stapes (stirrup) located in the middle ear is the smallest bone.
The Femur (thigh bone) is the largest and strongest bone.

questions.q: Who was appointed as the new Chairman of the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) in early 2024?
What is India's rank in the Global Hunger Index (GHI) 2024?

Statement:
Some beds are rivers.
All rivers are mats.
Conclusion:
1. All mats are rivers.
2. Some beds are mats.
questions.e:
1. "All rivers are mats" does not imply "All mats are rivers" (Mat is the outer circle). Conclusion 1 is false.
2. Since "Some beds are rivers" and "All rivers are mats", the part of the bed that is a river must also be a mat. Thus, "Some beds are mats" is true.

questions.q: In $\Delta ABC$, if $AB = 6$ cm, $AC = 8$ cm, and $BC = 10$ cm, then the measure of $\angle A$ is:
questions.e:
Check for Pythagoras triplet:
$6^2 + 8^2 = 36 + 64 = 100$.
$10^2 = 100$.
Since $AB^2 + AC^2 = BC^2$, the triangle is right-angled at A.
$\angle A = \mathbf{90^\circ}$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Check sides.**
Sides are 6, 8, 10.
Divide by 2 $\rightarrow$ 3, 4, 5.
(3, 4, 5) is a standard Pythagorean triplet.

**Step 2: Identify Hypotenuse.**
The longest side is BC (10).
The right angle is always opposite the hypotenuse.

**Step 3: Conclusion.**
Angle opposite to BC is $\angle A$.
Therefore, $\angle A = 90^\circ$.

questions.q: What is the capital city of Australia?
A can complete a work in 10 days and B in 15 days. If they work on alternate days starting with A, in how many days will the work be completed?
questions.e:
LCM(10, 15) = 30.
Eff: A=3, B=2.
Cycle (2 days): $A+B = 3+2 = 5$ units.
Cycles needed: $30/5 = 6$ cycles.
Total Days $= 6 \times 2 = \mathbf{12}$ days.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Find Total Work & Efficiency.**
Total Work = 30 units.
A's rate = 3 units/day.
B's rate = 2 units/day.

**Step 2: Calculate work per cycle.**
Day 1 (A) + Day 2 (B) = $3 + 2 = 5$ units in 2 days.

**Step 3: Find number of cycles.**
$\frac{30}{5} = 6$ full cycles.
Time = $6 \text{ cycles} \times 2 \text{ days/cycle} = 12$ days.

questions.q: Which of the following is a Noble Gas?
questions.e:
Argon ($Ar$) is a Noble Gas (Group 18). These gases are chemically inert/unreactive.
Other noble gases: Helium, Neon, Krypton, Xenon, Radon.

questions.q: In which year did the partition of Bengal take place?
Kaziranga National Park is famous for which animal?
Who was appointed as the new Secretary General of NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) in October 2024?
Which organization was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize for 2024?
Virus : Smallpox :: Bacteria : ?
questions.e:
Relationship: Causative Agent.
Smallpox is caused by a Virus (Variola).
Similarly, Typhoid is caused by Bacteria (Salmonella typhi).
(Note: Chickenpox is Virus, Malaria is Protozoa).

questions.q: Which organelle is known as the 'Powerhouse of the Cell'?
questions.e: Mitochondria are called the powerhouse of the cell because they produce energy in the form of ATP (Adenosine Triphosphate) through cellular respiration.

questions.q: Nurse : Ward :: Teacher : ?
questions.e:
The relationship is **Professional : Place of Work**.
A Nurse works in a Ward.
Similarly, a Teacher works in a Class (or Classroom).
While a teacher interacts with students and lessons, the "Class" represents the specific workspace corresponding to the "Ward."

questions.q: Pointing to a man in a photograph, a woman said, "His brother's father is the only son of my grandfather." How is the woman related to the man in the photograph?
questions.e:
Break it down backwards:
1. "Only son of my grandfather" $\to$ Woman's Father.
2. "His brother's father" $\to$ Man's Father.
3. Equating both: Man's Father is Woman's Father.
Since they share the same father, the woman is the **Sister** of the man.

questions.q: If EAR = 235, TEAK = 7238 then KARATE = ?
questions.e:
Assign digits to letters based on the given codes:
E=2, A=3, R=5
T=7, E=2, A=3, K=8
For the word **KARATE**:
K=8, A=3, R=5, A=3, T=7, E=2.
So, KARATE = **835372**.

questions.q: Which country held the Presidency of the G20 for the year 2024?
In a mixture of 60 liters, the ratio of milk and water is 2:1. If this ratio is to be 1:2, then the quantity of water to be further added is:
questions.e:
Initial: Milk = 40L, Water = 20L.
Target Ratio 1:2 means Water must be double of Milk.
Target Water $= 40 \times 2 = 80$L.
Added Water $= 80 - 20 = \mathbf{60}$L.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Find initial quantities.**
Total = 60L. Ratio 2:1.
Milk = $\frac{2}{3} \times 60 = 40$L.
Water = $\frac{1}{3} \times 60 = 20$L.

**Step 2: Analyze Target Ratio.**
New Ratio = 1:2 (Milk:Water).
Milk remains constant at 40L.
So, $1 \text{ part} = 40$L.
Water ($2 \text{ parts}$) = $80$L.

**Step 3: Calculate Added Water.**
Required - Existing = $80 - 20 = 60$ Liters.

questions.q: A shopkeeper offers a "Buy 3, Get 2 Free" scheme. What is the net percentage discount?
questions.e:
Use the "Free / Total" trick.
Discount $\% = \frac{\text{Free Items}}{\text{Total Items}} \times 100$.
Total items = $3 (\text{paid}) + 2 (\text{free}) = 5$.
Discount $= \frac{2}{5} \times 100 = 40\%$.
questions.e2:
Let Price of 1 item = $₹10$.
Total MP of 5 items = $₹50$.
Customer pays for 3 items = $₹30$.
Discount = $50 - 30 = ₹20$.
$\% D = \frac{20}{50} \times 100 = 40\%$.

questions.q: Five girls are sitting in a row. Rashi is not adjacent to Sulekha or Abha. Anuradha is not adjacent to Sulekha. Rashi is adjacent to Monika. Monika is at the middle in the row. Then, Anuradha is adjacent to whom out of the following?
questions.e:
Let's deduce the positions step-by-step:
1.  **Fix the Anchor:** "Monika is at the middle in the row."
Arrangement: `_ _ Monika _ _`
2.  **Place Rashi:** "Rashi is adjacent to Monika."
Rashi can be to the immediate left or right of Monika. Let's assume left for now (the logic works symmetrically).
Arrangement: `_ Rashi Monika _ _`
3.  **Identify Rashi's Neighbor:** "Rashi is not adjacent to Sulekha or Abha."
The spot to the left of Rashi cannot be taken by Sulekha or Abha. Since Monika is already seated to the right, the only person left to sit on Rashi's left is **Anuradha**.
Arrangement: `Anuradha Rashi Monika _ _`
4.  **Check Constraints:**
* "Anuradha is not adjacent to Sulekha." In this setup, Anuradha is next to Rashi, and Sulekha would be in one of the last two spots (far away). This holds true.
5.  **Conclusion:**
Based on the arrangement `Anuradha - Rashi - Monika - ...`, **Anuradha** is sitting adjacent to **Rashi**.

questions.q: Which country officially became the 32nd member of NATO (North Atlantic Treaty Organization) in March 2024?
Which space agency launched the 'Europa Clipper' mission to study Jupiter's moon Europa in October 2024?
Who took charge as the Chief of the Army Staff (COAS) of India in June 2024?

Seven people, I, J, K, L, O, P and Q are sitting in a row, facing north. Only two people sit to the right of I. Only two people sit between I and O. Only two people sit between J and P. P sits to the immediate left of I. Q sits to the immediate right of L. Who sits at third position from the left end of the line?
questions.e:
Arrange the 7 positions (1 to 7 from Left):
1. **"Only two people sit to the right of I"**: I is at position 5. (Layout: _ _ _ _ I _ _)
2. **"Only two people sit between I and O"**: O must be at position 2. (Layout: _ O _ _ I _ _)
3. **"P sits to the immediate left of I"**: P is at position 4. (Layout: _ O _ P I _ _)
4. **"Only two people sit between J and P"**: P is at 4, so J must be at 1 or 7.
5. **"Q sits to the immediate right of L"**: We need two adjacent empty spots for pair LQ.
* The only adjacent empty spots are 6 and 7.
* So, L is at 6 and Q is at 7.
* This forces J to be at position 1.
6. **Fill the blank**: The remaining spot (3) is for K.
Final Arrangement: **J O K P I L Q**.
The person at the 3rd position is **K**.

questions.q: 12 men or 24 boys can do a work in 20 days. In how many days will 24 men and 12 boys together complete the same work?
questions.e:
Relation: $12M = 24B \Rightarrow 1M = 2B$.
Team: $24M + 12B = 24(2B) + 12B = 60B$.
Total Work (in Boys): $24B \times 20 = 480$.
Time $= \frac{480}{60} = \mathbf{8}$ days.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Establish efficiency relationship.**
"12 Men or 24 Boys" means their total output is equal.
$12 \text{ Men} = 24 \text{ Boys} \Rightarrow 1 \text{ Man} = 2 \text{ Boys}$.

**Step 2: Convert everything to one unit (Boys).**
Target Team: 24 Men + 12 Boys.
Convert Men to Boys: $24 \text{ Men} = 24 \times 2 = 48 \text{ Boys}$.
Total Team Strength $= 48 \text{ Boys} + 12 \text{ Boys} = 60 \text{ Boys}$.

**Step 3: Calculate Total Work.**
Given: 24 Boys take 20 days.
Total Work $= 24 \times 20 = 480$ units.

**Step 4: Calculate Time.**
Days $= \frac{\text{Total Work}}{\text{New Strength}} = \frac{480}{60} = 8$ days.

questions.q:
Select the option that is related to the third word on the same basis as the second word is related to the first word.
Knife : Butcher :: Scissors : ?
questions.e: This relates a tool to its professional user: just as a knife is the tool of a butcher, scissors are the tool of a hair dresser.

questions.q: Atoms of the same element having the same atomic number but different mass numbers are called:
questions.e:
Isotopes have the same number of protons (Atomic Number) but different number of neutrons (resulting in different Mass Numbers).
Example: Carbon-12 and Carbon-14.
* Isobars: Same mass number, different atomic number.

questions.q: The battle of Plassey was fought in which year?
A student has to secure 35% marks to pass. He gets 80 marks and fails by 60 marks. Find the maximum marks of the exam.
questions.e:
Use the "Logic Method".
Pass Marks = Marks Scored + Failed By.
Pass Marks = 80 + 60 = 140.
This 140 marks is equal to 35%.
35% = 140.
1% = 140 / 35 = 4.
Total (100%) = 4 × 100 = 400.
questions.e2:
Equation Method.
Let Maximum Marks = M.
35% of M = 80 + 60.
(35 / 100) × M = 140.
M = (140 × 100) / 35.
M = 4 × 100 = 400.

questions.q: The product of two numbers is $2160$ and their HCF is $12$. Find their LCM.
questions.e:
Use the direct formula:
$\text{Product} = \text{HCF} \times \text{LCM}$.
$2160 = 12 \times \text{LCM}$.
$\text{LCM} = \frac{2160}{12} = 180$.
questions.e2:
Let numbers be $a$ and $b$.
Given $a \times b = 2160$.
HCF $= 12$.
We know that for any two numbers, product of numbers equals product of LCM and HCF.
$\text{LCM} = \frac{2160}{12}$.
$12 \times 100 = 1200$.
$12 \times 80 = 960$.
Total $180$.

questions.q: The 'Panchayati Raj' system was first adopted by which state in India?
Under the 'Pradhan Mantri Vishwakarma Yojana', artisans are provided loans at a concessional interest rate of:

Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, decide which of the given conclusion(s) logically follow(s).
Statements:
All induction are stove.
Some stove are oven.
Some oven are tandoor.
Conclusions:
(I) Some tandoor are induction.
(II) Some oven are induction.
questions.e:
**Venn Diagram Analysis:**
1. **All Induction are Stove:** The Induction circle is inside the Stove circle.
2. **Some Stove are Oven:** The Oven circle overlaps with the Stove circle, but not necessarily with the Induction circle.
3. **Some Oven are Tandoor:** The Tandoor circle overlaps with the Oven circle.
**Check Conclusions:**
(I) No direct relation between Tandoor and Induction. (False)
(II) No direct relation between Oven and Induction. (False)
Result: **Neither follows**.

questions.q: In a certain code language, if MOBILE is coded as 713694 and TABLET is coded as 253942, then BALLET will be coded as?
questions.e:
Mapping letters to digits from the words MOBILE and TABLET:
M=7, O=1, B=3, I=6, L=9, E=4
T=2, A=5, B=3, L=9, E=4, T=2
For the word **BALLET**:
B=3, A=5, L=9, L=9, E=4, T=2.
So, BALLET = **359942**.

questions.q: Who is known as the 'Iron Man of India'?

What should come in place of the question mark (?) in the given series based on the English alphabetical order?
TCL ZIR FOX LUD ?
questions.e:
The series follows a forward shift pattern of **+6** for every letter position.
1. **1st Letter**: T (20) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ Z (26) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ F (6) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ L (12) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ **R** (18).
2. **2nd Letter**: C (3) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ I (9) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ O (15) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ U (21) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ **A** (1).
3. **3rd Letter**: L (12) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ R (18) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ X (24) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ D (4) $\xrightarrow{+6}$ **J** (10).
Result: **RAJ**.

questions.q: A bag contains ₹1, 50p, and 25p coins in the ratio 5:6:8. If the total amount in the bag is ₹240, find the number of 25p coins.
questions.e:
Value ratio:
₹1: $5 \times 1 = 5$.
50p: $6 \times 0.5 = 3$.
25p: $8 \times 0.25 = 2$.
Total Ratio Value $= 5 + 3 + 2 = 10$ units.
$10 \text{ units} = 240 \Rightarrow 1 \text{ unit} = 24$.
Number of 25p coins $= 8 \text{ units} = 8 \times 24 = \mathbf{192}$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Convert coin count to value.**
Ratio of coins = 5 : 6 : 8.
Values = ₹1, ₹0.5, ₹0.25.
Value Contribution = $(5 \times 1) + (6 \times 0.5) + (8 \times 0.25)$.
$= 5 + 3 + 2 = 10x$.

**Step 2: Equate to total amount.**
$10x = 240$.
$x = 24$.

**Step 3: Find count of specific coin.**
25p coins = $8x$.
$8 \times 24 = 192$ coins.

questions.q: If "−" and "x" signs as well as "4" and "3" are interchanged, then which of the value is 2 + 9 ÷ 4 − 3 × 1?
questions.e:
Interchange signs (– with x) and numbers (4 with 3):
New Equation: $2 + 9 \div 3 \times 4 - 1$
Apply BODMAS:
1. Division: $9 \div 3 = 3$
2. Multiplication: $3 \times 4 = 12$
3. Addition/Subtraction: $2 + 12 - 1 = \mathbf{13}$.

questions.q: Four letter-clusters have been given, out of which three are alike in some manner and one is different. Select the odd one.
questions.e:
Analyze the difference between consecutive letters in each cluster.
1.  **OQS**: O (+2) $\to$ Q (+2) $\to$ S. (Pattern: +2, +2)
2.  **JLN**: J (+2) $\to$ L (+2) $\to$ N. (Pattern: +2, +2)
3.  **UWY**: U (+2) $\to$ W (+2) $\to$ Y. (Pattern: +2, +2)
4.  **ADG**: A (**+3**) $\to$ D (**+3**) $\to$ G. (Pattern: +3, +3)
ADG is the odd one out as it follows a different pattern.

questions.q: A sum of money becomes 3 times itself in 10 years at a certain rate of Simple Interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
questions.e:
Let Principal $= P$. Amount $= 3P$.
Interest $= 3P - P = 2P$.
$SI = \frac{P \times R \times T}{100}$
$2P = \frac{P \times R \times 10}{100}$
$2 = \frac{R}{10} \Rightarrow R = \mathbf{20\%}$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Determine Interest.**
To become 3 times itself, the money must earn an interest equal to 2 times the principal (Principal + 2P Interest = 3P Total).

**Step 2: Apply SI Formula.**
$2P = \frac{P \times R \times 10}{100}$.
Cancel P from both sides.
$2 = \frac{R}{10}$.

**Step 3: Solve for R.**
$R = 20$.

questions.q: The average of $5$ consecutive odd numbers is $27$. Find the product of the first and the last number.
questions.e:
Concept: Average is the Middle Number.
Numbers: $23, 25, \mathbf{27}, 29, 31$.
First $= 23$, Last $= 31$.
Product $= 23 \times 31$.
Unit digit $3 \times 1 = 3$. (Check options ending in 3).
Answer $= 713$.
questions.e2:
Let numbers be $x, x+2, x+4, x+6, x+8$.
Average $= x+4$.
$x+4 = 27 \implies x = 23$.
Last $= 23+8 = 31$.
Product $= 23 \times 31 = 713$.

questions.q: Rubi and Juhi are sisters. Krishna is Juhi's father's father. Reshma is the mother of Arvind. Arvind is the father of Rohit, who is the only brother of Rubi. How is Krishna related to Rohit?
questions.e:
Use the "Sibling Link" shortcut.
1. Rohit is the brother of Rubi, and Rubi is the sister of Juhi.
2. So, Rohit, Rubi, and Juhi are all siblings.
3. Therefore, Juhi's father is also Rohit's father.
4. Krishna is "Juhi's father's father".
5. Replace "Juhi" with "Rohit" $\to$ Krishna is Rohit's father's father.
questions.e2:
Step-by-Step mapping:
1. Siblings: Rohit, Rubi, Juhi.
2. Father: Arvind is the father of Rohit (so he is the father of all three).
3. Grandfather: Krishna is Juhi's father's father. Since Arvind is the father, Krishna is Arvind's father.
4. Relation: Krishna is the father of Rohit's father.
Result: Father's father.

questions.q: Typhoid fever is caused by which of the following?
questions.e: Typhoid is a bacterial infection caused by the bacterium *Salmonella typhi*. It is usually spread through contaminated food or water.

questions.q: A dishonest shopkeeper professes to sell his goods at cost price but uses a weight of 900 grams instead of a 1 kg weight. Find his gain percentage.
questions.e:
Formula: $\text{Gain}\% = \frac{\text{Error}}{\text{True Value}} \times 100$.
Error $= 1000 - 900 = 100$g.
True Value (Given) $= 900$g.
Gain $= \frac{100}{900} \times 100 = \frac{100}{9} = \mathbf{11.11\%}$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Determine Error.**
He cheats by 100g (1000g - 900g).

**Step 2: Determine Cost Base.**
His cost is for the 900g he actually gives.
Cost Base = 900g.

**Step 3: Calculate Percentage.**
Gain = $\frac{100}{900} \times 100 = 11.11\%$.

questions.q: The Modern Periodic Table is based on the increasing order of:
questions.e: H.G.J. Moseley showed that the Atomic Number ($Z$) is a more fundamental property than Atomic Mass. Mendeleev's table was based on Atomic Mass.

questions.q:
Interchanging which two signs will make the following equation correct?
15 + 3 x 9 − 4 ÷ 16 = 57
questions.e:
Test Option 4 by interchanging "+" and "÷":
New Equation: $15 \div 3 \times 9 - 4 + 16$
Apply BODMAS:
1. Division: $15 \div 3 = 5$
2. Multiplication: $5 \times 9 = 45$
3. Addition/Subtraction: $45 - 4 + 16 = 41 + 16 = \mathbf{57}$.
Since L.H.S = R.H.S, interchanging + and ÷ is correct.

questions.q: FILM : ADGH :: MILK : ?
questions.e:
Logic: $-5$ Shift for each letter.
F (-5) $\to$ A
I (-5) $\to$ D
L (-5) $\to$ G
M (-5) $\to$ H
Apply to MILK:
M (-5) $\to$ H
I (-5) $\to$ D
L (-5) $\to$ G
K (-5) $\to$ F
Result: HDGF.

questions.q: If E = 5, GUN = 42 and ROSE = 57, then what is the value of GATE?
questions.e:
The logic is the **Sum of Alphabetical Positions**.
1.  **E** is the 5th letter $\to$ 5.
2.  **GUN**: G(7) + U(21) + N(14) $= 42$.
3.  **ROSE**: R(18) + O(15) + S(19) + E(5) $= 57$.
4.  **GATE**:
* G $\to$ 7
* A $\to$ 1
* T $\to$ 20
* E $\to$ 5
* Sum $= 7 + 1 + 20 + 5 = 33$.

questions.q: On August 23, India celebrates 'National Space Day' to commemorate the success of which mission?
Find the value of $\sqrt{30 + \sqrt{30 + \sqrt{30 + \dots}}}$
questions.e:
Shortcut: For $\sqrt{x + \sqrt{x + \dots}}$, find consecutive factors of $x$.
$30 = 5 \times 6$.
For '$+$' sign, answer is the **larger** factor.
Ans = **6**.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Assume the expression is equal to x.**
Let $x = \sqrt{30 + \sqrt{30 + \sqrt{30 + \dots}}}$

**Step 2: Square both sides.**
$x^2 = 30 + x$ (Since the infinite series remains $x$ inside).

**Step 3: Solve the quadratic equation.**
$x^2 - x - 30 = 0$.
Find factors of -30 that add to -1: (-6 and +5).
$(x - 6)(x + 5) = 0$.

**Step 4: Find roots.**
$x = 6$ or $x = -5$.
Since a square root result is positive, $x = 6$.

questions.q: Vinod starts from point A and drives 8 km towards the west. He then takes a left turn, drives 6 km, turns left and drives 12 km. He then takes a left turn and drives 11 km. He takes a final left turn, drives 4 km and stops at point P. How far and towards which direction should he drive in order to reach point A again?
questions.e:
Trace the path using coordinates (Start A = 0,0):
1. West 8 km: $(-8, 0)$.
2. Left (South) 6 km: $(-8, -6)$.
3. Left (East) 12 km: $(-8 + 12, -6) = (4, -6)$.
4. Left (North) 11 km: $(4, -6 + 11) = (4, 5)$.
5. Left (West) 4 km: $(4 - 4, 5) = (0, 5)$. (Point P).
Current position P is $(0, 5)$, which is **5 km North** of A $(0,0)$.
To return to A, he must drive **5 km South**.

questions.q: At what rate percent per annum simple interest will a sum of money double itself in 8 years?
questions.e2:
* Interest earned = Principal (P).
* Time = 8 years.
* $P = (P \times R \times 8) / 100$.
* $100 = 8R \Rightarrow R = 12.5$.

questions.q: What is the valency of Carbon?
questions.e: Carbon (Atomic Number 6) has an electronic configuration of 2, 4. It needs 4 electrons to complete its octet (or shares 4). Thus, its valency is 4 (Tetravalent).

questions.q: Sundar starts from point A and drives 12 km towards the east. He then takes a left turn, drives 9 km, turns left and drives 13 km. He then takes a left turn and drives 11 km. He takes a final left turn, drives 1 km and stops at point P. How far (shortest distance) and towards which direction should he drive in order to reach point A again?
questions.e:
Let A be at origin (0,0).
1. 12 km East $\rightarrow$ (12, 0).
2. Left (North) 9 km $\rightarrow$ (12, 9).
3. Left (West) 13 km $\rightarrow$ (12 - 13, 9) = (-1, 9).
4. Left (South) 11 km $\rightarrow$ (-1, 9 - 11) = (-1, -2).
5. Left (East) 1 km $\rightarrow$ (-1 + 1, -2) = (0, -2).
Point P is at (0, -2). Point A is at (0, 0).
To go from P to A, he must travel **2 km North**.

questions.q:
Statement:
Remote drums are pleasant.
Conclusion:
I. Humans are never fully satisfied in life.
II. Humans beings tends to see their flaws more seriously and do not consider the possibility that they may have a superior bottom line.
o: Both conclusion I and II follows.
Both conclusion I and II follows.
questions.e:
The statement "Remote drums are pleasant" (often translated as "Distant drums sound sweet") is a proverb implying that things often appear better from a distance than they actually are, or that people appreciate what they do not have more than what they do.
This metaphorical meaning aligns with Conclusion I: "Humans are never fully satisfied in life" (they always want the 'distant' thing).
Conclusion II is complex and does not directly follow from the simple metaphorical meaning of the proverb.
Therefore, only conclusion I follows.

questions.q: Who discovered the 'Cell' in 1665?
questions.e:
Robert Hooke discovered the cell while observing a thin slice of cork under a primitive microscope.
* Robert Brown: Discovered Nucleus.

questions.q: MP 14 is related to LS −1 in a certain way. In the same way, NK 5 is related to MN −10. To which of the given options is SW −1 related?
questions.e:
Analyze the shift in letters and numbers separately:
1. **First Letter**: $M(13) \xrightarrow{-1} L(12)$. $N(14) \xrightarrow{-1} M(13)$.
Apply to S: $S(19) \xrightarrow{-1} \textbf{R}(18)$.
2. **Second Letter**: $P(16) \xrightarrow{+3} S(19)$. $K(11) \xrightarrow{+3} N(14)$.
Apply to W: $W(23) \xrightarrow{+3} \textbf{Z}(26)$.
3. **Number**: $14 \xrightarrow{-15} -1$. $5 \xrightarrow{-15} -10$.
Apply to -1: $-1 - 15 = \mathbf{-16}$.
Result: **RZ -16**.

questions.q: Which acid is present in an ant sting?
questions.e:
An ant sting contains Methanoic Acid (also known as Formic Acid), which causes pain and irritation.

* Citric Acid: Lemons
* Lactic Acid: Curd/Milk
* Acetic Acid: Vinegar.

questions.q: The length of a rectangle is increased by 20% and its breadth is decreased by 10%. What is the percentage change in its area?
questions.e:
Use formula: Net% $= x + y + \frac{xy}{100}$
Here $x = +20, y = -10$.
Net $= 20 - 10 + \frac{20 \times (-10)}{100}$
$= 10 - 2 = \mathbf{+8\%}$ (Increase).
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Understand the formula.**
For successive percentage changes, use:
Effect $= A + B + \frac{AB}{100}$.

**Step 2: Substitute values.**
Length ($A$) increases by 20% $\rightarrow +20$.
Breadth ($B$) decreases by 10% $\rightarrow -10$.

**Step 3: Calculate.**
Effect $= 20 - 10 + \frac{20 \times -10}{100}$
$= 10 - \frac{200}{100}$
$= 10 - 2 = 8$.
Since the result is positive, it is an **8% increase**.

questions.q: The diagonal of a cube is $6\sqrt{3} \text{ cm}$. Find its volume.
questions.e:
Formula: Diagonal $= a\sqrt{3}$.
$a\sqrt{3} = 6\sqrt{3} \implies a = 6$.
Volume $= a^3 = 6^3 = 216 \text{ cm}^3$.
questions.e2:
Use Pythagoras in 3D.
$D = \sqrt{l^2 + b^2 + h^2}$.
Since it is a cube, $D = \sqrt{a^2 + a^2 + a^2} = \sqrt{3a^2} = a\sqrt{3}$.
Given $a\sqrt{3} = 6\sqrt{3}$, so Side $= 6$.
Vol $= 6 \times 6 \times 6 = 216$.

[Image of cube diagonal formula]

questions.q: A thief is spotted by a policeman from a distance of 200 meters. When the policeman starts the chase, the thief also starts running. If the speed of the thief is 10 km/h and that of the policeman is 11 km/h, how far would the thief have run before he is overtaken?
questions.e:
Relative Speed $= 11 - 10 = 1$ km/h.
Distance gap $= 200$ m $= 0.2$ km.
Time to catch $= \frac{0.2}{1} = 0.2$ hours.
Distance run by thief $= \text{Speed} \times \text{Time}$
$= 10 \times 0.2 = \mathbf{2}$ km.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Find Relative Speed.**
Since they run in the same direction:
$S_{rel} = 11 - 10 = 1$ km/h.

**Step 2: Calculate Time.**
Gap = 200m = 0.2km.
Time = $\frac{\text{Distance}}{\text{Speed}} = \frac{0.2}{1} = 0.2$ hours.

**Step 3: Calculate Distance for Thief.**
Distance = $10 \text{ km/h} \times 0.2 \text{ h} = 2$ km.

questions.q: Myopia (Near-sightedness) can be corrected by using which type of lens?
questions.e:
In Myopia, a person can see near objects clearly but distant objects appear blurry because the image forms *in front* of the retina. A Concave lens is used to diverge the light rays so they focus *on* the retina.

[Image of myopia correction diagram]

questions.q: Who won the Nobel Prize in Literature 2024?

Statements:
1. All cats are animals.
2. Some animals are dogs.
Conclusions:
I. Some cats are dogs.
II. Some dogs are cats.
III. No cat is a dog.
IV. Some animals are cats.
Which conclusion(s) logically follow?
questions.e:
Use Venn Diagram Logic:
1. **Diagram**: Draw a circle for 'Cats' inside a larger circle for 'Animals'. Draw a circle for 'Dogs' intersecting 'Animals'. The 'Dogs' circle may or may not touch 'Cats'.
2. **Analyze IV**: "Some animals are cats". Since all cats are animals, the part of the Animal circle occupied by Cats proves this is **True**.
3. **Analyze I, II, III**: There is no direct statement linking Cats and Dogs. They might overlap or they might not. Therefore, we cannot definitely conclude I, II, or III.
4. **Options**: While I and III form a complementary pair (Either-Or), Option 3 excludes Conclusion IV. Since IV is definitely true, Option 1 is the correct choice.

questions.q:
Read the given statements and conclusions carefully. Assuming that the information given in the statements is true, even if it appears to be at variance with commonly known facts, decide which of the given conclusions logically follow(s) from the statements.
Statements:
Some guns are bombs.
Some guns are cargos.
Some bombs are riffles.
Conclusions:
(I): Some guns are riffles.
(II): Some bombs are cargos.
questions.e:
1. **Analyze Statement 1 & 3:** "Some guns are bombs" and "Some bombs are riffles". There is a common link (Bombs), but no definite link between Guns and Riffles. The parts of "Bombs" that are "Guns" might be totally separate from the parts that are "Riffles". Thus, Conclusion I does not follow.
2. **Analyze Statement 1 & 2:** "Some guns are bombs" and "Some guns are cargos". There is a common link (Guns), but no definite link between Bombs and Cargos. The specific "Guns" that are "Bombs" may not be the same "Guns" that are "Cargos". Thus, Conclusion II does not follow.
Since neither is definitely true, the answer is **Neither conclusion (I) nor (II) follows**.

questions.q: A starts a business with an investment of ₹4000. After 3 months, B joins him with an investment of ₹16000. Find the ratio of their profits at the end of one year.
questions.e: Profit Ratio = Investment $\times$ Time.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Determine Investment and Time for A.**
Investment A = 4000.
Time A = 12 months (Full year).
Product A = $4000 \times 12 = 48,000$.

**Step 2: Determine Investment and Time for B.**
Investment B = 16000.
Time B = B joined after 3 months, so he stayed for $12 - 3 = 9$ months.
Product B = $16000 \times 9 = 1,44,000$.

**Step 3: Calculate Ratio.**
Ratio = $48,000 : 1,44,000$.
Divide by 1000 $\rightarrow$ $48 : 144$.
Divide by 48 $\rightarrow$ $1 : 3$.

questions.q: If "-" and "+" signs as well as "x" and "÷" are interchanged, then which of the following is the value of 27 − 15 + 84 × 6 ÷ 13 ?
questions.e:
Interchange the signs as per the instruction: "-" becomes "+", "+" becomes "-", "x" becomes "÷", and "÷" becomes "x".
New Equation: $27 + 15 - 84 \div 6 \times 13$
Apply BODMAS:
1. Division: $84 \div 6 = 14$
2. Multiplication: $14 \times 13 = 182$
3. Addition/Subtraction: $27 + 15 - 182 = 42 - 182 = \mathbf{-140}$ (Note: The source image calculation $27 + 210 - 13 = 224$ assumes a different order or grouping; however, following the standard BODMAS on the swapped expression $27 + 15 - 14 \times 13$ yields -140. Looking at the source's provided steps: $27 + 15 \times 14 - 13 = 27 + 210 - 13 = 224$).

questions.q: If $x = 7 + 4\sqrt{3}$, find the value of $x + \frac{1}{x}$.
questions.e:
Check difference of squares: $7^2 - (4\sqrt{3})^2 = 49 - 48 = 1$.
If difference is $1$:
$x + \frac{1}{x} = 2 \times \text{Bigger Term}$.
Result $= 2 \times 7 = 14$.
(Note: $x - \frac{1}{x} = 2 \times \text{Smaller Term} = 8\sqrt{3}$).
questions.e2:
Rationalize $\frac{1}{x}$.
$\frac{1}{7+4\sqrt{3}} \times \frac{7-4\sqrt{3}}{7-4\sqrt{3}} = 7-4\sqrt{3}$.
Add: $(7 + 4\sqrt{3}) + (7 - 4\sqrt{3}) = 14$.

questions.q: Find the range of the following data: 8, 12, 5, 15, 21, 9, 17.
questions.e:
Range = Maximum Value - Minimum Value.
Max = 21.
Min = 5.
Range = $21 - 5 = \mathbf{16}$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Identify Max and Min.**
From the set {8, 12, 5, 15, 21, 9, 17}:
Highest number = 21.
Lowest number = 5.

**Step 2: Calculate Range.**
Difference = $21 - 5 = 16$.

questions.q: Which Indian chess Grandmaster became the youngest-ever challenger for the World Chess Championship by winning the Candidates Tournament 2024?
Which Indian state has the longest coastline?

In the following triads, each group of letters is related to the subsequent one following a certain logic. Select from the given options, the one that follows the same logic.
BORE - EOBR - ORBE
RUST - TURS - USRT
questions.e:
Assign numbers to the first word (1-2-3-4) and trace the positions.
Pattern: **1234** $\to$ **4213** $\to$ **2314**
Example 1: B(1)O(2)R(3)E(4) $\to$ E(4)O(2)B(1)R(3) $\to$ O(2)R(3)B(1)E(4).
Example 2: R(1)U(2)S(3)T(4) $\to$ T(4)U(2)R(1)S(3) $\to$ U(2)S(3)R(1)T(4).
Check Option 2: **JUSL**
1.  First shift (4213): L(4) - U(2) - J(1) - S(3) $\to$ **LUJS**. (Matches).
2.  Second shift (2314): U(2) - S(3) - J(1) - L(4) $\to$ **USJL**. (Matches).
Result: **JUSL - LUJS - USJL**.

questions.q: If the number $5432A7$ is divisible by 9, then the digit in place of A is:
questions.e:
Divisibility rule of 9: Sum of digits must be divisible by 9.
Sum $= 5+4+3+2+A+7 = 21 + A$.
Next multiple of 9 after 21 is 27.
$21 + A = 27 \Rightarrow A = \mathbf{6}$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Sum the known digits.**
$5 + 4 + 3 + 2 + 7 = 21$.

**Step 2: Apply Divisibility Rule of 9.**
For the entire number to be divisible by 9, $(21 + A)$ must be divisible by 9.

**Step 3: Find A.**
The multiples of 9 are 9, 18, 27, 36...
Since $A$ is a single digit (0-9), the only possible sum is 27.
$21 + A = 27$.
$A = 6$.

questions.q: A is twice as efficient as B. If B can complete a piece of work in 20 days, in how many days can A complete the same work?
questions.e:
Efficiency Ratio A:B = 2:1.
Time Ratio A:B = 1:2.
If B takes 20 days (2 units), A takes 1 unit.
Time for A = $20/2 = \mathbf{10}$ days.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Understand Efficiency vs Time.**
Efficiency is inversely proportional to Time.
If A is 2 times faster, A takes half the time.

**Step 2: Calculate.**
Time taken by B = 20 days.
Time taken by A = $20 / 2 = 10$ days.

questions.q: If $x + \frac{1}{x} = 5$, find the value of $x^2 + \frac{1}{x^2}$.
questions.e:
Use Formula: $k^2 - 2$.
Here $k = 5$.
Value $= 5^2 - 2 = 25 - 2 = 23$.

questions.q: Which soil is most suitable for the cultivation of cotton?
Who built the famous Sanchi Stupa?
If @ means +, # means —, $ means x and * means ÷, then what is the value of 16 @ 4 $ 5 # 72 * 8 =
questions.e:
Step 1: Decode the symbols.
$16 + 4 \times 5 - 72 \div 8$
Step 2: Apply BODMAS rule.
1. Division: $72 \div 8 = 9$.
$\to 16 + 4 \times 5 - 9$
2. Multiplication: $4 \times 5 = 20$.
$\to 16 + 20 - 9$
3. Addition & Subtraction: $36 - 9 = 27$.
Result: **27**.

questions.q: Evaluate the value of: $\sin^2 60^\circ + \cos^2 30^\circ + \cot 45^\circ$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Recall trigonometric values.**
$\sin 60^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$
$\cos 30^\circ = \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}$
$\cot 45^\circ = 1$

**Step 2: Square the values.**
$\sin^2 60^\circ = \left(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\right)^2 = \frac{3}{4}$.
$\cos^2 30^\circ = \left(\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\right)^2 = \frac{3}{4}$.

**Step 3: Add them up.**
Sum $= \frac{3}{4} + \frac{3}{4} + 1$.
$= \frac{6}{4} + 1 = \frac{3}{2} + 1 = 1.5 + 1 = 2.5$.

questions.q:
Statement:
All students of department 'A' are intelligent.
Mangesh is not intelligent.
Conclusion:
1) Mangesh is not in the department 'A'
2) Mangesh is intelligent.
questions.e:
This follows the logic of Modus Tollens:
If one is in Dept A, one is Intelligent.
Mangesh is NOT Intelligent.
Therefore, Mangesh cannot be in Dept A.
Conclusion 1 follows. Conclusion 2 contradicts the statement.

questions.q: Which type of mirror is used by dentists to see a larger image of teeth?
questions.e:
Dentists use Concave Mirrors because when the tooth is placed close to the mirror (within the focus), it produces a magnified, upright, and virtual image.
* Rear-view mirrors in cars use Convex mirrors (wider field of view).

questions.q:
Which of the following letter-clusters should replace # and % so that the pattern and relationship followed between the letter-cluster pair on the left side of :: is the same as that on the right side of ::?
# : JLH :: IKG : %
questions.e:
Check Option 3: # = EGC, % = NPL.
**Left Pair (EGC : JLH):**
E (5) $\xrightarrow{+5}$ J (10)
G (7) $\xrightarrow{+5}$ L (12)
C (3) $\xrightarrow{+5}$ H (8)
Pattern: **+5, +5, +5**.

**Right Pair (IKG : NPL):**
I (9) $\xrightarrow{+5}$ N (14)
K (11) $\xrightarrow{+5}$ P (16)
G (7) $\xrightarrow{+5}$ L (12)
Pattern: **+5, +5, +5**.
Since the patterns are identical, Option 3 is correct.

questions.q: The lengths of the diagonals of a rhombus are $16 \text{ cm}$ and $12 \text{ cm}$. Find the side of the rhombus.
questions.e:
Use "Half-Diagonal Pythagoras" trick.
Halves are $8$ and $6$.
Triplet $(6, 8, 10)$.
Side $= 10 \text{ cm}$.
questions.e2:
Diagonals bisect at $90^\circ$.
Let diagonals be $d_1 = 16, d_2 = 12$.
Half diagonals are $8$ and $6$.
Side $a = \sqrt{8^2 + 6^2}$.
$a = \sqrt{64 + 36} = \sqrt{100} = 10 \text{ cm}$.

questions.q: An electric bulb is rated 220 V and 100 W. When it is operated on 110 V, the power consumed will be:
questions.e:
First, find the resistance ($R$) of the bulb.
$$P = \frac{V^2}{R} \Rightarrow R = \frac{V^2}{P} = \frac{220 \times 220}{100} = 484 \ \Omega$$
Now, calculate power at $V' = 110 \text{ V}$.
$$P' = \frac{(V')^2}{R} = \frac{110 \times 110}{484} = \frac{12100}{484} = 25 \text{ W}$$
(Since voltage is halved, power becomes 1/4th).

questions.q: If $\sin \theta = \frac{3}{5}$, find the value of $(\tan \theta + \sec \theta)^2$.
questions.e2:
**Step 1: Find the third side.**
Using Pythagoras triplet (3, 4, 5). Perpendicular=3, Hypotenuse=5, so Base=4.

**Step 2: Find trig ratios.**
$\tan \theta = \frac{P}{B} = \frac{3}{4}$.
$\sec \theta = \frac{H}{B} = \frac{5}{4}$.

**Step 3: Evaluate expression.**
$(\frac{3}{4} + \frac{5}{4})^2 = (\frac{8}{4})^2 = 2^2 = 4$.

questions.q: What is the mass of 1 mole of Water ($H_2O$)?
questions.e:
Atomic masses: $H = 1$, $O = 16$.
Molecular mass of $H_2O = (2 \times 1) + 16 = 2 + 16 = 18 \text{ g/mol}$.

questions.q: The length, breadth, and height of a room are $6 \text{ m}$, $3 \text{ m}$, and $2 \text{ m}$. Find the length of the longest pole that can be placed in the room.
questions.e:
Use Formula: Diagonal $= \sqrt{l^2 + b^2 + h^2}$.
$D = \sqrt{6^2 + 3^2 + 2^2}$.
$D = \sqrt{36 + 9 + 4}$.
$D = \sqrt{49} = 7 \text{ m}$.
questions.e2:
Calculate base diagonal first.
Base $d = \sqrt{36+9} = \sqrt{45}$.
Room $D = \sqrt{(\sqrt{45})^2 + 2^2} = \sqrt{45+4} = 7$.

questions.q: A sum of money becomes $8$ times itself in $3$ years at Compound Interest. Find the rate of interest per annum.
questions.e:
Use "Cube Root" trick for 3 years.
Growth factor = $8$.
Root: $\sqrt[3]{8} = 2$.
This means money doubles ($1 \to 2$) every year.
Interest = $2 - 1 = 1$.
Rate $= \frac{1}{1} \times 100 = 100\%$.

questions.q: Current : Ampere :: Resistance : ?
questions.e:
Relationship: Quantity : SI Unit.
The SI unit of Electric Current is Ampere.
The SI unit of Electrical Resistance is Ohm.

questions.q: Which train runs between India and Pakistan?
